poem:
Hiroshima's Echo

The air was filled with whispers, still warm,  
ten-year-old feet on remnants of home.   
Ashes rose like ghosts, silent,  
etched on the breeze with stories untold.  
Under a sun veiled in grief,  
memory clings to the charred sky —  
a fragile tether,  
between what was,  
and shadows of a nuclear dawn.
